section.section: In cooperation with appropriate State and local units and in accordance with State and federal law, the Commission shall foster plans to enhance the coordination of federal- and State-funded programs and services regarding responsible fatherhood.

The Commission shall develop a coordinated comprehensive statewide plan, including estimates of necessary public and private funding, for:
increasing the participation of fathers in raising their children; and
improving services to noncustodial fathers.

In accordance with the statewide plan, the Commission shall recommend to the Governor distribution of community incentive grants concerning responsible fatherhood from funds provided in the State budget for this purpose or from grants or private donations, giving priority to innovative projects that:
promote the establishment of a coordinated network of services for noncustodial fathers; and
demonstrate a high level of commitment to the project by making available nonstate funds, personnel, and facilities.
